newsitem.title: USA: Open Market in AT&T Internet deal.
newsitem.headline: Open Market in AT&T Internet deal.

text.p: Internet electronic commerce company Open Market Inc said on Tuesday it licensed its software to AT&T Corp in a multi-year deal to support AT&T Web site services.

The deal confirms a story that appeared in the Boston Globe last week, which sent Open Market stock soaring from $14 to a peak of $25 on Nasdaq. The shares were down $1-1/8 to 23-1/8 on today's confirmation.
Open Market's OM-Transact software will be used by AT&T, providing order management, online customer services, buyer authentication and flexible payment models.

"Our decision to work with Open Market was based upon their innovative approach to secure Internet commerce and their early delivery of advanced technology," said Kathleen Earley, a vice president at AT&T EasyCommerce Services. -- Nick Louth, New York Newsroom 212 859 1712
